app.viewmanagers

Class SidebarViewManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.viewmanagers.SidebarViewManager

  • public class SidebarViewManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the Sidebar control, which consists of various buttons for interacting with the application.

      • SidebarViewManager

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the fxml file has been loaded. Also sets the event listeners for each button.

      • clickedButton

        private void clickedButton(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
        Apply the button's event listener. Some actions are immediate upon clicking (undo, redo), while the rest fill the input field with a command string.
        Parameters:
        button -

      • tryUndo

        private void tryUndo()
        Attempt to undo the state. Show error if there's nothing to undo.

      • tryRedo

        private void tryRedo()
        Attempt to redo the state. Show error if there's nothing to redo.

      • isRedoable

        private boolean isRedoable()
        Check with UndoController if there's anything to undo.
        Returns:
        true if undoable

      • isUndoable

        private boolean isUndoable()
        Check with UndoController if there's anything to redo.
        Returns:
        true if redoable

      • setRootViewManager

        public void setRootViewManager(RootViewManager rootViewManager)
        Set back-reference to rootViewManager.
        Parameters:
        rootViewManager -

      • refreshUndoButton

        public void refreshUndoButton()
        This is called whenever there is a change of list state. Grey out undo button if there is nothing to undo.

      • refreshRedoButton

        public void refreshRedoButton()
        This is called whenever there is a change of list state. Grey out redo button if there is nothing to redo.
